issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
TestNodeHealthService failures:
testNodeHealthScript(org.apache.hadoop.yarn.server.nodemanager.TestNodeHealthService)  Time elapsed: 1.405 sec  <<< ERROR!
java.io.FileNotFoundException: C:\Users\Administrator\Documents\hadoop-common\hadoop-yarn-project\hadoop-yarn\hadoop-yarn-server\hadoop-yarn-server-nodemanager\target\org.apache.hadoop.yarn.server.nodemanager.TestNodeHealthService-localDir\failingscript.cmd (The process cannot access the file because it is being used by another process)

fields.summary: TestAMRestart and TestNodeHealthService failing sometimes on Windows

comments.body:
{color:green}+1 overall{color}.  Here are the results of testing the latest attachment 
  http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12639901/YARN-1933.1.patch
  against trunk revision .

    {color:green}+1 @author{color}.  The patch does not contain any @author tags.

    {color:green}+1 tests included{color}.  The patch appears to include 2 new or modified test files.

    {color:green}+1 javac{color}.  The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

    {color:green}+1 javadoc{color}.  There were no new javadoc warning messages.

    {color:green}+1 eclipse:eclipse{color}.  The patch built with eclipse:eclipse.

    {color:green}+1 findbugs{color}.  The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs (version 1.3.9) warnings.

    {color:green}+1 release audit{color}.  The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

    {color:green}+1 core tests{color}.  The patch passed unit tests in hadoop-yarn-project/hadoop-yarn/hadoop-yarn-server/hadoop-yarn-server-nodemanager hadoop-yarn-project/hadoop-yarn/hadoop-yarn-server/hadoop-yarn-server-resourcemanager.

    {color:green}+1 contrib tests{color}.  The patch passed contrib unit tests.

Test results: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-YARN-Build/3561//testReport/
Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-YARN-Build/3561//console

This message is automatically generated.

There is one minor import conflict due to which the patch isn't applying anymore. Fixed that myself and reviewed the patch and ran tests.

The changes look fine and the tests pass. Will fix the import issue myself.

Same patch with the import issues fixed.

Will check this in if Jenkins says okay..

{color:green}+1 overall{color}.  Here are the results of testing the latest attachment

Committed this to trunk, branch-2 and branch-2.4. Thanks Jian!
